params.text:
Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Decreased cognitive function (attention, memory, learning)
  • Decreased reaction time, walking speed, tremors, and increased risk for Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
  • Altered mood and behavior (including increased risk of anxiety, depression and schizophrenia)

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Reduced brain volume and altered brain neurochemistry
  • Decreased cognitive function

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Greater systolic and diastolic blood pressure and increased risk of hypertension
  • Greater risk of atherosclerosis
  • Altered cardiac conduction
  • Decreased blood hemoglobin and platelet count
  • Decreased platelet count

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Increaed risk of prevelance of heart disease
  • Increased mortality risk due to cardiovascular diseases
  • Anemia and decreased blood hemoglobbin

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Proteinuria
  • Chronic Kidney Disease
  • Altered Kidney funciton and decreased glomerular filtration rate

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Enzymuria
  • Histopathological damage

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Gastrointesinal symptoms such as abdominal colic and discomfort

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

Gastrointesinal symptoms such as abdominal colic, discomfort, pain, nasuea, vomiting, diarrhea and/or constipation

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Gastrointesinal symptoms such as abdominal colic and discomfort

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Gastrointesinal symptoms such as abdominal colic, discomfort, pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea and/or constipation

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Gastrointesinal symptoms such as abdominal colic and discomfort

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Gastrointesinal symptoms such as abdominal colic, discomfort, pain, nasuea, vomiting, diarrhea and/or constipation

Lead exposure levels less than or equal to 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Altered serum levels of thyroid hormones such as thyroid stimulating hormone

Lead exposure levels greater than 10 μg/dL have been associated with:

  • Increased thyroid perioxidase antibodies
  • Altered serum concentrations of reproductive hormones (testosterone, FSH, LH)
